column5: Installed 1x 1.5” heavy duty streamline on port prop shaft
Cleaning complete, will return with shaft anodes
Paint disintegration around forward starboard thruhulls.

Replaced: 
4 x 1” streamlined shaft anodes on swim platform struts ($13),
4 x 1-1/2” streamlined shaft anodes on prop shafts ($23)
2 x 2.5” trim tab anodes on trim tabs ($10). 
Diver’s dream on transom in good condition.
Attempted to clear forward thru-hulls, but the seacocks were closed.
Trim tabs anode bolt holes should be drilled out to accept the larger bolts now standard on the 3.25”+ anodes. I can do that on the next service. In the meantime, I have installed 2.5” trim tab anodes.

All anodes need replacing. I will source the correct anodes and return. The paint around the forward starboard thru-hull  drains is deteriorating rapidly, possibly due to material being discharged. Try to avoid discharging harsh liquids to preserve the paint.
Trim tabs look excellent, except tiny hole in starboard tab. Not structural.
Visibility nearly zero, no usable after video :( Checked anodes, scrubbed down running gear and hull.
Shaft  anodes likely need replacing on next service
Installed (4) 1-1/2” heavy duty streamlined shaft and 612HD hull anodes
